Articles.Content:
So, I'm planning my first interplanetary mission to Duna in .23 and want to carry/return as little mass as possible. With the introduction of the ability to transfer science from an experiment to the command pod, I was considering just dumping my experiments when I prepared for my return, transferring the last bits of data to the command pod. I was curious if this had any effect on the amount of science returned? Is transferring science the same as returning the experiment, or is it just like transmitting?

Mods used: FAR, FASA, TAC life support, TAC Fuel Balancer, Crew Manifest, KAC, DRE, RealChute

Edited December 27, 2013 by Taki117
I don't know if the mods you are using would make a difference, but in stock there will be no change in the amount of science you receive.
Transferring is just transferring. When you return and recover the capsule with the data that has been transferred to it, you will get full value.
As another person playing with FAR/DRE, I can confirm that this works and you get full value, much easier than trying to reenter with a bunch of science parts.
That's what I do. I go as far as mounting all the science bits on decouplers, sometimes, so I can leave them on, say, the surface of the Mun. Saves some fuel taking off.
